intro: Sarcomelicope glauca, commonly known as the blue-leafed hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue-green foliage. The plant produces showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically white or pale blue in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
